title: THE SECRET OF SECRETS
author: Dan Brown
description: As he searches for the missing noetic scientist he has been seeing, Robert Langdon discovers something regarding a secret project.

title: THE ACADEMY
author: Elin Hilderbrand and ShelCunningham
description: Harmful rumors cause trouble for the students and staff at a New England boarding school.

title: THE GINGERBREAD BAKERY
author: Laurie Gilmore
description: The fifth book in the Dream Harbor series. As a wedding approaches, a bakery owner and a bar owner get closer.

title: THE HOUSEMAID
author: Freida McFadden
description: Troubles surface when a woman looking to make a fresh start takes a job in the home of the Winchesters.

title: THE LAST LETTER
author: Rebecca Yarros
description: Ryan asks his friend Beckett to help his sister, who is caring for her twin children in Telluride.

title: POEMS & PRAYERS
author: Matthew McConaughey
description: The actor and author of “Greenlights” explores elements of belief and reason that make up our lives.

title: CONFRONTING EVIL
author: Bill O'Reilly and Josh Hammer
description: O'Reilly and Hammer profile some of history’s nefarious characters.

title: ALL THE WAY TO THE RIVER
author: Elizabeth Gilbert
description: The author of “Eat, Pray, Love” depicts her journey through a cycle involving self-destructive tendencies.

title: THE BOOK OF SHEEN
author: Charlie Sheen
description: The actor, known for his roles in “Platoon” and “Two and a Half Men,” shares stories about his life in Hollywood.

title: HISTORY MATTERS
author: David McCullough
description: A posthumous collection of essays by the Pulitzer Prize-winning author on history’s impact on our present and our future; edited by Dorie McCullough Lawson and Michael Hill.

title: CALLED TO TAKE A BOLD STAND
author: Jack Hibbs

title: THE POISONED KING
author: Katherine Rundell. Illustrated Ashley Mackenzie
description: Christopher and Anya must save the dragons of the Archipelago from a strange new threat. (Ages 10 and up)

title: TROUBLING TONSILS!
author: Aaron Reynolds. Illustrated Peter Brown
description: Charlie Marmot's infected tonsils have disappeared before surgery! (Ages 6 to 9)

title: POCKET BEAR
author: Katherine Applegate. Illustrated Charles Santoso
description: Zephyrina brings a rare stuffed bear back to the Second Chances Home for the Tossed and Treasured. (Ages 8 to 12)

title: WONDER
author: R.J. Palacio
description: A boy with a facial deformity starts school. (Ages 8 to 12)

title: THE NINE MOONS OF HAN YU AND LULI
author: Karina Yan Glaser
description: Parallel stories that take place in 731 China and 1931 Chinatown, N.Y., about the struggles of two Chinese families. (Ages 8 to 12)

title: THE LEAF THIEF
author: Alice Hemming. Illustrated Nicola Slater
description: Squirrel attempts to figure out who has stolen his leaves. (Ages 4 to 8)

title: HOW TO CATCH A WITCH
author: Alice Walstead. Illustrated Megan Joyce
description: The Catch Club Kids attempt to snare a witch on Halloween. (Ages 4 to 7)

title: ZOMBIE AND BRAIN ARE FRIENDS
author: Stephanie V.W. Lucianovic. Illustrated Laan Cham
description: Zeb the zombie and Brian the brain become friends. (Ages 4 to 8)

title: THE WONDERFUL THINGS YOU WILL BE
author: Emily Winfield Martin
description: A celebration of future possibilities. (Ages 3 to 7)

title: JUST SHINE!
author: Sonia Sotomayor. Illustrated Jacqueline Alcántara
description: A tribute to the Supreme Court justice’s mother. (Ages 4 to 8)

title: THE SUMMER I TURNED PRETTY TRILOGY
author: Jenny Han
description: A beach house, summer love and enduring friendships. (Ages 12 and up)

title: THE HUNGER GAMES
author: Suzanne Collins
description: In a dystopia, a girl fights for survival on live TV. (Ages 12 and up)

title: THE POWERLESS TRILOGY
author: Lauren Roberts
description: A story of forbidden love between Paedyn, an Ordinary, and Kai, an Elite, in the kingdom of Ilya. (Ages 14 and up)

title: HARRY POTTER
author: J.K. Rowling
description: A wizard hones his conjuring skills in the service of fighting evil. (Ages 10 and up)

title: DIARY OF A WIMPY KID
author: Jeff Kinney. Illustrated Jeff Kinney
description: The travails and challenges of adolescence. (Ages 9 to 12)

title: HEKATE: THE WITCH
author: Nikita Gill
description: To avoid enslavement by the Olympians, Hekate is hidden in the underworld to make a life for herself. (Ages 14 to 18)

title: HOUR OF THE PUMPKIN QUEEN
author: Megan Shepherd
description: After a potion demonstration goes awry, Sally and Luna fall through a portal to Time Town. (Ages 12 and up)

title: THORN SEASON
author: Kiera Azar
description: In the Kingdom of Daradon, where wielding magic is treason, Alissa Paine must conceal her magical abilities or face persecution. (Ages 14 and up)

title: A THEORY OF DREAMING
author: Ava Reid
description: In the sequel to "A Study in Drowning," Effy and Preston return to the University of Llyr. (Ages 14 and up)

title: BLOOD MOON
author: Britney S. Lewis
description: Mira discovers that the legends of werewolves in her hometown are true. (Ages 14 to 17)
